headline: 'Trump is the president of instability and uncertainty, increasingly to his own detriment'
description: By continually flouting the rules, railing against institutions and single-handedly steering his country toward a new war, the president of the United States has demonstrated nothing but his inability to act as a statesman, observes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

headline: Christophe Leribault to be appointed new Louvre president
Annick Lemoine leaves Petit Palais to become Musée d'Orsay president
Several extremist French groups come under government scrutiny
description: After the fatal beating of a far-right activist, the Interior Ministry is considering banning several groups and has reported the possible 'reconstitution' of a banned far-left group, Jeune Garde, to the courts.

headline: Tigray, in northern Ethiopia, is facing the threat of another war
description: The Ethiopian government has assembled troops on the border of its northern region amid a surge of tensions that has been not seen since the end of the war in 2022, a conflict that claimed 600,000 lives over two years.

headline: Rekindled love: 'Something had happened and it split me in two. I had never experienced that before'
description: They met, fell in love and then parted ways. Life's twists and turns eventually brought them back together. Sylvain, 53, shares his story with Laurence, who is also 53.

headline: Four years of war in Ukraine: Five photographers on assignment for Le Monde share their most striking images from 2025
description: Five photographers who covered the conflict in 2025 have each chosen an emblematic image of the conflict. Beyond the official figures and statements, these unique perspectives reveal the mark that this new year of war has left on them.

headline: 2030 Winter Olympics top organizer steps down
Iran says 'unprecedented' deal 'within reach' ahead of US talks
US ambassador Kushner promises not to 'interfere' in French affairs
'The US Supreme Court tariff decision helps dispel the image of an institution that has become entirely subservient to the president'
Rescuers search for missing after deluge kills at least 30 in Brazil
Who will replace Mexican druglord 'El Mencho'?
London Fashion Week: A season of reinvention
Warner Bros opens door to Paramount as bidding war continues to heat up
Cristel, the high-end cookware specialist, to open a second production site
Four years of war in Ukraine: Odesa's complex 'derussification'
Germany is being forced to confront its growing competition with China
France's struggling winemakers to get €40 million in aid, announces EU farming chief
Donald Trump's support with 'bro culture' is waning
description: With his racist post about the Obamas, support for immigration police and decision to politicize Puerto Rican singer Bad Bunny's halftime Super Bowl show, the US president has alienated some of his supporters.

headline: Understanding the battle of Verdun through rare or little-known photographs
description: A book published to mark the 110th anniversary of the legendary battle brings to light many images taken by army photographers. Le Monde is presenting several of these photographs, offering a glimpse into the reality behind this symbol of the First World War.

headline: With expected US retreat, Germany seeks to strengthen its role within NATO
description: Berlin has invested hundreds of billions of euros to rearm since Russia's invasion of Ukraine in 2022 and aims to play a major role within the North Atlantic Alliance, particularly as the US moves toward isolation.

headline: Mexico's endless battle against drug trafficking
Jean Pisani-Ferry: 'German commitment to rearmament is good news and a challenge for Europe'
Vladimir Putin, trapped by his own logic of war
